title: I'm so sick and tired of Nasus existing.
body:
"But all you have to do is zone him from farm" HOW!? LIKE LEGIT? HOW!? 

Like, there is not early way you can zone him from 100% farm, he's GOING to get strong, he's going to outscale you, he's going to auto you for 1000 HP witha  sheen proc and there is ABSOLUTELY nothing i seem to be able to do, to stop him. It's so unbelievably infuriating, i can't win a SINGLE game against this fucking champion and he's in litterally every game that i play top. Why? Why can't i go ONE game without seeing this peice of shit, infinitely stacking mother fucking dog. 

"Zone him off of minion, keep him from stacking, that's how you win." 

EVERY SINGLE PERSON WHO HAS NEVER PLAYED AGAINST HIM AS A BRUISER WILL SAY THIS EXACT LINE! Do you know what this means? Nothing, because this doesn't work! Like, this has NEVER worked for me, no matter how much i freeze waves, no matter how much i stand between him and his minions he STILL get's strong, by level 9 he'll come back and 1v1 me with no issue at all, every. single. fucking. time. 

I can't stand this champion, i hate all Infinitely stacking champions, they shouldn't exist, i want all of them removed from the game forever. 

(Or at the very least make it so you don't have BABY SIT THEM FOR 50 FUCKING MINUTES) 

END OF SALT FUELED RANT!

Honestly I hate Nasus, but that’s because I really suck at wave management. 

Nasus is going to get stacks. This is a truth that is universal. The best way to deal with that is to win the game before he becomes a threat. 

Which is frustrating, I’ll admit.
Yeah i despize "Time Bomb" champs, champions that put the whole game under pressure because if you don't win before a certain time, they win.
Feel like there's a Zilean joke here but I don't think I have the time to think of it...

I have found, both in my games playing as Nasus and in my games playing against Nasus, that he is actually an extreme midgame threat.

He _will_ outscale every laner and win every lane.  He _will_ become a threat.  It's almost impossible to stop, and there will come a time when he becomes an absolute monster. 

But later on, when everyone gets towards full build, there becomes too much damage for Nasus to deal with.  Nasus gets infinite stacking damage, but  he does not have infinite durability, and it doesn't matter how much damage his Q does when he gets CC'd and melted by a lategame ADC.

The issue with Nasus isn't really ending the game before he becomes big.  He'll become big.  The issue you have when facing him is surviving that monster phase till your team becomes too strong for Nasus to handle.

> The best way to deal with that is to win the game before he becomes a threat.

Yeah, but the problem with this is that this allows a lot of players to climb to elos they shouldn't be in. This is because in plat and below, no one can close out a game before 40 minutes, no matter how fed you get. Basically nasus is a guaranteed win in plat<.

I'll tell you a secret - there's no winning against Nasus right now. All advice about shutting him down early is old, from past seasons, and completely null and void at the moment. The only thing preventing Nasus from being a complete monstrosity is that bot lane completely determines the game, and you'll know who wins in 15 min based on bot. So Nasus being disgustingly OP doesn't really matter at the end of the day.

pfft easy solution. just 1v5 him. sure he'll take a champ or two with him, but...ummm. Where was this going?
Counterplay to any champion is 1v5ing them with hard CC

As dumb as that sounds, it does work against nasus

like, he's not going to E>Q one-shot your alistar or thresh who built full tank support

and during the fight if your alistar or thresh (or even janna) is smart, they'll pop some cc on nasus when he goes in to fight anyone which slows him down massively. And then the rest of your team will chew through him since the only defensive thing he can do is gain a little bit more max health with his ult. Like if karma fires every q on nasus, him walking around with reduced movespeed throughout the fight actually lowers his threat so much.

OP's problem is he's looking at league of legends as a 1 v 1 game, but every tank is going to outperform and outcontribute nasus in teamfights, and every ~~bruiser and fighter~~ just about everyone is going to have free reign to farm up just as much as nasus during the laning phase.
And then while your team is busy 1v5ing him, the other four members of his team have taken baron, a drake, and are now pushing your mid inhib
Teemo does not counter Nasus. Nasus is top 5 win rate or top 10 in every bracket.

Teemo can blind him and prevent stacks, possibly even miss some cs. He can poke from a safe distance to the point where they will back off the waves or get punished for. If he is passive long enough to let the waves go to the turret, you can still blind him under turret and further kill his farm. He's a very flexible champion that can build ad, ap, speed, or even tank, which helps to work around whatever build they go with in assumption of what you might build. There are many ways to play Teemo, and if your way doesn't work, that doesn't mean that there isn't a way that it does work.
Well usually post 6 Nasus wins every fight against Teemo unless seriously behind.
{{champion:75}} : "The cycle of Life and Death continues. I will Q, they will QQ."

The best Champion to play into Nasus is Darius. The problem with playing Teemo is that Teemo seems like a good choice on paper, but as soon as Nasus gets a Spectre's Cowl and level 6 or 7, he'll just wither you, walk up and kill you if you don't have flash (and sometimes when you do have flash).

To beat Nasus, you need to get a seriously good freeze going right outside of your tower. The best way to do this is to set it up so their wave has 4 melee minions in addition to their regular wave more than your wave. The important thing is, DO NOT PUSH. Nasus feels safest when he's farming under his own tower. Yes, you're sacrificing tower damage in this situation, but you're also keeping Nasus out of the game for as long as possible. 

Now when you get your Freeze going, the moment, the exact SECOND, you see that stack whore go for a minion, you beat his ass. Harass the fuck out of him, but don't let the wave push. This forces him to choose between waiting out what could potentially be a very long freeze nd losing a crap ton of CS, or trading health for bits of gold here and there. This becomes especially effective at level 6, where you now have kill potential on him. I once literally FlameHorizoned a Nasus by getting an extremely long freeze going. I was at 114 CS by the time the freeze broke and he was able to get his 14th minion, and at that point, it was over for him.

Now, disclaimer, most of this shit only really works for champions who can actually bully. It also assumes this isn't Klepto Nasus (which I'm pretty sure won't exist soon anyway because Riot, so whatever)
Yeah post 6 Nasus beats the shit out of teemo.

{{champion:83}} {{champion:240}}

Honestly?  I'm a otp Renekton.

Just push.  

Start at level 1 and just keep pushing.

Let his jungler come, then try to kill his jungler if you can; otherwise escape.

Worry about his cs, which you can effect, over his stax, which you inevitably can't.

If you harass him enough early on, try to finish him off or at least force him to flash/tele; take ignite if you're playing as someone with a lot of threat.

You're generally not gonna do anything but push until you kill his first tower.  Hopefully his jungler doesn't harass you to the point where you can't even do that, but if he does your jungler's bound to do something more useful in the meantime.  Just accept that you're not gonna have a fun or exciting laning phase and do nothing but push to his tower and harass him under tower.
Ban him then lol.

When I used to play Lissandra in top lane, I felt an instant urge to just go afk the moment I saw I was up against Nasus. There was literally NOTHING I could do to stop him from powerfarming and becoming a lategame monster.
That's what I hate about the infinite stacking mechanics of Veigar and Nasus. Other champions who also have those have it pretty well balanced. You don't feel overwhelmed and powerless after Bard, Thresh, Sion, or even Kindred get some stacks. (With Cho'Gath it really depends, because his stacking is the most situational, I guess, but I would place him among Veigar and Susan). But when Nasus gets a ton of stacks you feel like the game is basically over.
It seems the only way to beat Nasus is either to pick a hardcounter or beg the jungler to camp you 24/7.
Our mid fed a tank veigar like 6 kills TANK VEIGAR...who was still hitting hard as fuck

Nasus is too strong atm, with bruisers who used to counter him being in a weak spot, and Riot buffed his early game a ton with the change to ult, giving him health, defensive stats and reduced Q CD.  They also got rid of some of his counter-play which was to build armor against him so that his Q damage didnt hurt as much, but since E now shreds % armor he can deal damage to everyone.

I love Nasus but Riot has taken away his real weaknesses.

That's just how Riot does scaling champions. No matter what you do, they will get strong at the scheduled time off passive gold and rubber band exp. Had a teammate afk at start and go 7 levels down by the time they reconnected. He was 1 level down 5 mins later.
{{champion:75}} needs a rework
